poem:
**Tiree Morning**

On this small slip of land, 12 by 3,  
where ocean whispers to boundless sky,  
we edge out on tireless seas,  
a splash, a sudden arc—  
and there, a whale breaches,  
momentarily  
turning the ocean  
into a theater,  
as Tiree holds its breath,  
spellbound by the leap  
of a massive, graceful line.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "20 family nature holidays in the UK – from kayaking to stargazing and whale watching Whale watching in the Hebrides There’s no escaping sea and sky on Tiree, as the Inner Hebridean island is only 12 miles long and 3 miles wide. Shallow seas provide rich feeding grounds for marine life, and it is one of the UK’s best spots for whale watching. Tiree Sea Tours – a member of the WiSe national training scheme". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
